abstract: Federal Reserve officials meet for annual policy retreat in Jackson Hole, Wyo, and are greeted by activists from across political spectrum who are concerned about Fed's plan to raise benchmark interest rate; experts say planned move should not inspire so much interest, but liberal activists are pushing Fed to keep interest rates low to help poor, minorities and unemployed, while conservative activists are urging Fed to adopt more restrained role.
lead_paragraph: An approaching action on interest rates is being closely watched as a broader debate divides liberals and conservatives over the management of the American economy.

headline.main: Challenged on Left and Right, the Fed Faces a Decision on Rates
headline.print_headline: Left and Right Work to Shift Fed’s Direction

snippet: An approaching action on interest rates is being closely watched as a broader debate divides liberals and conservatives over the management of the American economy.
